page.title: 08BIOGRAPHY-BERKELEY FAMILY
page.content: {SPETCHLEY} Rowland Berkeley settled in Worcester in 1574 where he set up as a wool merchant and clothier. He bought Spetchley Park from Philip Sheldon for Â£1400 in 1606 for his son Robert. Sir Robert fought in the Battle of Worcester and was sent to the Tower of London. Sir Robert was a keen horticulturalist and planted many of the species in the Gardens. The original Hall was destroyed by Scots Royalists to stop Cromwell using it as a base and so the family lived for 2 centuries in the converted stable blocks. A later Berkeley was Sheriff of Worcester and founded the Berkeley Hospital Almshouses there. In {1942}the family tree was retraced and the present owner's father was proven to be the rightful owner.(The present owners are{Mr and Mrs RGJ Berkeley of {Berkeley Castle, Gloucestershire)
